title: Establishes the NYS Triangle Shirtwaist Fire 100th anniversary commemoration commission
summary: Establishes the NYS Triangle Shirtwaist fire 100th anniversary commemoration commission to focus attention upon the 100th anniversary of the Triangle Shirtwaist Fire on March 25, 2011.

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         1819

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 13, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen.  PARKER -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Finance

       AN ACT in relation to creating the New York  state  Triangle  Shirtwaist
         Fire 100th anniversary commemoration commission; and providing for the
         repeal of such provisions upon expiration thereof

         THE  PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Legislative findings. 1. The legislature hereby  finds  and
    2  declares  there is a need to create a New York state Triangle Shirtwaist
    3  Fire 100th anniversary commemoration commission to focus attention  upon
    4  the  100th  anniversary  of the March 25, 1911 Triangle Shirtwaist Fire,
    5  during a commemoration period taking place March 25, 2011, through Octo-
    6  ber 14, 2011, the anniversary of the date that the American  Society  of
    7  Safety Engineers was founded as a result of the fire.
    8    2.  The  primary  focus of the New York state Triangle Shirtwaist Fire
    9  100th anniversary commemoration commission will be to plan  and  execute
   10  an  organized series of Triangle Shirtwaist Fire educational and tourism
   11  events. The tourism events will highlight the following key  sites:  the
   12  site  of  the  Triangle  Shirtwaist Factory, Mount Richmond Cemetery and
   13  Cemetery of the Evergreens.
   14    3. The legislature finds that the creation of a New York state  Trian-
   15  gle Shirtwaist Fire 100th anniversary commemoration commission is neces-
   16  sary  to  bring  together  persons  qualified by experience or by powers
   17  vested in them by their offices to  coordinate  and  facilitate  such  a
   18  historically important event.
   19    S 2. New York state Triangle Shirtwaist Fire 100th anniversary commem-
   20  oration commission created. 1. There is hereby created a temporary state
   21  commission  to  be known as the "New York state Triangle Shirtwaist Fire
   22  100th anniversary commemoration commission".

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD02140-01-1

       S. 1819                             2

    1    2. Definitions. As used in this act: (a) "Commission"  means  the  New
    2  York  state  Triangle  Shirtwaist  Fire  100th anniversary commemoration
    3  commission created by this section.
    4    (b) "Historical interpreter" means a person who is a recognized member
    5  of  a  duly  constituted  organization approved by the host site and who
    6  participates in the main Triangle Shirtwaist Fire educational and  tour-
    7  ism event for the year.
    8    3.  (a)  The commission shall consist of 13 members to be appointed as
    9  follows: the commissioner of parks, recreation and historic preservation
   10  or his or her duly designated representative, the commissioner of educa-
   11  tion or his or her duly designated representative, the  commissioner  of
   12  economic  development  or his or her duly designated representative, the
   13  commissioner of labor or his  or  her  duly  designated  representative,
   14  representatives  from  the  International Ladies' Garment Workers' Union
   15  (ILGWU), New York University, the National Women's Hall  of  Fame,  Fire
   16  Department  of  New  York, and the Fashion Institute of Technology, four
   17  members of the Triangle Shirtwaist fire reenactment  community  of  whom
   18  one  shall  be  appointed  by the temporary president of the senate, one
   19  shall be appointed  by  the  speaker  of  the  assembly,  one  shall  be
   20  appointed  by  the  minority  leader  of  the  senate  and  one shall be
   21  appointed by the minority leader of the assembly.  The  commissioner  of
   22  parks,  recreation  and  historic preservation or his or her duly desig-
   23  nated representative shall serve as chairperson of the  commission.  The
   24  13 appointed members shall serve at the pleasure of the appointing offi-
   25  cial. Appointments shall be made within 60 days of the effective date of
   26  this  act.  If  a  member misses three meetings his or her seat shall be
   27  considered vacant. Vacancies shall be filled in the manner provided  for
   28  in the original appointments.
   29    (b)  The  members  of the commission shall receive no compensation for
   30  their services but shall be reimbursed for their  actual  and  necessary
   31  expenses incurred by them in the performance of their duties.
   32    (c) Notwithstanding any inconsistent provision of any general, special
   33  or  local  law,  ordinance, resolution or charter, no officer, member or
   34  employee of the state or of any public corporation shall forfeit his  or
   35  her  office or employment by reason of his or her acceptance of appoint-
   36  ment as a member of the commission, nor shall service as such commission
   37  member be deemed incompatible or in conflict with such office or employ-
   38  ment.
   39    (d) The commission shall appoint such staff as  may  be  necessary  to
   40  carry out its duties.
   41    S  3.  Powers  and duties of the commission. The commission shall have
   42  the following powers and duties:
   43    1. To coordinate the commemoration of the  100th  anniversary  of  the
   44  Triangle Shirtwaist Fire.
   45    2.  To plan and execute an organized series of educational and tourism
   46  events focusing on the Triangle Shirtwaist Fire, the founding of  Ameri-
   47  can  Society  of Safety Engineers and the reinvigoration of the Interna-
   48  tional Ladies' Garment Workers' Union.
   49    3. To promote Triangle Shirtwaist Fire educational studies  in  grades
   50  kindergarten through 12 in New York state schools.
   51    S 4. Employment. The commission may employ and at pleasure remove such
   52  personnel as it may deem necessary for the performance of its functions.
   53  The  commission may meet and hold public and private hearings within the
   54  state, and shall have all the powers of a legislative committee pursuant
   55  to the legislative law.

       S. 1819                             3

    1    S 5. Assistance and data. The commission may request and shall receive
    2  from any subdivision, department, board, commission, office, agency,  or
    3  other  instrumentality of the state or any political subdivision thereof
    4  such facilities, assistance and data as it deems necessary or  desirable
    5  for  the proper execution of its powers and duties and to effectuate the
    6  purposes set forth in this act.
    7    S 6. Agreements. The commission is hereby authorized and empowered  to
    8  enter  into  any  agreements  and to do and perform any acts that may be
    9  necessary, desirable or proper to carry out the purposes and  objectives
   10  of this act.
   11    S  7.  This  act shall take effect immediately and shall expire and be
   12  deemed repealed October 14, 2011.
memo:
BILL NUMBER:S1819

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
in relation to creating the New York state Triangle Shirtwaist Fire
100th anniversary commemoration commission; and providing for the repeal
of such provisions upon expiration thereof

PURPOSE OR GENERAL IDEA OF BILL:
To create a temporary commission to commemorate the 100th anniversary
of the Triangle Shirtwaist Factory fire.

SUMMARY OF SPECIFIC PROVISIONS:
Section 1- Legislative Findings
section 2. Creates the commissions; defines terms
Section 3. Composition of commission
Section 4. Employment
Section 5. Assistance and data
Section 6. Agreements
Section 7. Effective date

JUSTIFICATION:
Near closing time on Saturday afternoon, March 25, 1911, a fire broke
out. One hundred forty six young immigrant women were killed, unable
to escape from their garment sweatshop one block east of Washington
square Park. Most women could not escape the burning building because
the managers would lock the doors to the stairwells and exits to keep
workers from taking cigarette breaks during their shifts. In an
effort to escape the flames, sixty-two persons died by jumping or
falling from the ninth floor. The fire was one of the largest
industrial disasters in the history of New York. The survivors were
left to live and relive those agonizing moments..The victims and
their families, the people passing by who witnessed the desperate
leaps from ninth floor windows and the city of New York would never
be the same.

The Triangle Shirtwaist Factory was located inside the Asch building,
now known as the Brown Building of Science. It has been designated as
a National Historic Landmark and a New York city landmark. The fire
led to legislation requiring improved factory safety standards and
helped spur the growth of the International Ladies' Garment Workers'
Union, which fought for better and safer working conditions for
sweatshop workers in that industry.

This event challenges not only the labor ethics of a century ago, but
those of today. The event highlighted the inhumane working conditions
to which industrial workers could be subjected. The New York state
legislature,
appalled by the event, created a commission to investigate
conditions in the city's sweatshops. As a result, the division of
Fire prevention was created as part of the Fire Department. Its
function is to rid factories of fire hazards.

The victims of the tragedy are still celebrated as martyrs at the
hands of industrial greed. Celebrating this milestone gives New
Yorkers the opportunity to appreciate and reflect on our history. New


York state, its counties, cities, towns and villages may profit, both
culturally and economically, from the benefits of a statewide
commission to help organize, promote and fully implement a major
commemoration of the 100th Anniversary of the Triangle Shirtwaist
Factory fire.
